Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; iinterior: glaze at top of wall above reserved band with dilute line and further glaze band; rest of bowl covered in fine dilute lines; exterior: reserved handle zone, glazed below with single reserved band.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.613 and 628; the rim is preserved on 613. The fabric, shape, and exterior pattern find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116). The interior decoration finds parallels with Vallet and Villiard's Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Schlotzhauer type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.152) (Phase 3)
